value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Anon.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#">"For many centuries after Britain became an island"</quote> the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gtre" key="Trevelyan, George">hist</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gtre"/>orian says " <quote source="#">"the untamed forest was king."</quote> Its 
            <choice>
              <sic>mosit</sic>
              <corr>moist</corr>
            </choice> and</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>mssy</sic>
              <corr>mossy</corr>
            </choice> floor was hidden from heavens eye by a close drawn</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">curtain of innumerable treetops. " On the matted bough</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">innumerable birds 
            <choice>
              <sic>snag</sic>
              <corr>sang</corr>
            </choice>; but their song was only heard by a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">few skin clad hunters in the 
            <choice>
              <sic>claetings</sic>
              <corr>clearings</corr>
            </choice>. Did the desire</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to sing come to one of those <add hand="ms" place="above">barbarians</add> savages because he 
            <choice>
              <sic>geard</sic>
              <corr>heard</corr>
            </choice> the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">birds sing, and so rested his axe against the tree for a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">moment? Anyhow, the tree was felled; some sort of hut</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">was made from its branches; and the clearing became larger;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the birds 
            <choice>
              <sic>f   er</sic>
              <corr>fewer</corr>
            </choice>; and the human voice sang instead. The first</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">songs are out of door songs; spring songs; summer songs;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">winter songs.</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>Bytuene Mersh and Averil</l>
            <l>When spray biginneth to springe,</l>
            <l>The lutel foul hath hire wyl</l>
            <l>on hyre lud to synge.</l>
          </quote>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>Sumer is icumen in,</l>
            <l>Lhude sing cuccu</l>
          </quote>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>By a bank as I lay</l>
            <l>Musing myself alone, hey ho!</l>
            <l>A birdes voice</l>
            <l>Did me rejoice,</l>
            <l>Singing before the day;</l>
            <l>And me thought in her lay</l>
            <l>She said winter was past, hey ho!</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They were out of door songs, because there was no</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">comfort indoors, little light, and no books. The eye</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">therefore was more active in in ourselves. The eye is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">young sense; the sense that is attached to the body.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Now and then, by 
            <choice>
              <sic>chooisng</sic>
              <corr>choosing</corr>
            </choice> a view carefully to shut out</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a chimney or a bungalow, we can still see a fragment of</l>
